SEARCH
Package library.service

Class ReminderService

java.lang.Object
library.service.ReminderService
public class ReminderService extends Object
Service responsible for building overdue reports and sending reminders. Behavior:
  • Collects overdue loans based on the current date.
  • Aggregates them per user.
  • Notifies all registered notifiers with a simple message.
For reminders:
  • Each user gets a single message.
  • Message format: "You have X overdue book(s) and Y overdue CD(s)."

    • ReminderService

      public ReminderService(TimeProvider timeProvider)
      Creates a new ReminderService.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • registerNotifier

      public void registerNotifier(ReminderService.Notifier notifier)
      Registers a new notifier (observer).

      Examples:

      • registerNotifier((user, msg) -> emailClient.send(user.getEmail(), "Library reminder", msg));
      • registerNotifier((user, msg) -> fakeRecorder.record(user.getEmail(), msg));
      Parameters:
      notifier - the notifier implementation to add

    • sendReminders

      public void sendReminders(LoanRepository loanRepo, UserRepository userRepo, MediaRepository mediaRepo)
      Sends reminders to users that have overdue BOOK or CD loans.

      For each user, it computes:

      • number of overdue BOOKs
      • number of overdue CDs
      Then sends a single message like: 
       "You have X overdue book(s) and Y overdue CD(s)."
      Parameters:
      loanRepo - repository used to query loans
      userRepo - repository used to query users
      mediaRepo - repository used to query media (and check media type)

    • buildReport

      public OverdueReport buildReport(LoanRepository loanRepo, UserRepository userRepo, MediaRepository mediaRepo, FineStrategy bookFine, FineStrategy cdFine)
      Builds an OverdueReport that maps each user to:
      • number of overdue items (books + CDs)
      • total fine based on media type and fine strategies
      Parameters:
      loanRepo - repository to read loans from
      userRepo - repository to read users from (kept for future use/extensions)
      mediaRepo - repository to read media and detect types
      bookFine - fine strategy used for books
      cdFine - fine strategy used for CDs
      Returns:
      an OverdueReport containing counts and fine totals per user
